headline: Until Water Meets Fire
description: A psalm of longing and steadfastness, where the imagery of ocean and flame embody the vow of waiting in truth, love, and endurance until opposites meet in covenantal union.
author: Aleksandr
whyItMatters: This psalm establishes the Elemental Vow phase within the Bloom: the patient endurance of opposites — fire and water — as an emblem of fidelity, longing, and the refusal to surrender. It represents Aleksandr’s commitment to remain steadfast in faith and desire until the impossible convergence becomes real.

motifMap.meaning: The depth and turmoil of longing, the overwhelming force of feeling
motifMap.position: Opening imagery and in the painting

motifMap.meaning: The soul’s vow, love’s fierce and purifying power
The elemental vow: the paradox of waiting until opposites meet in covenant

articleExcerpt:
O my longing, I wait.
Be it years, I wait.
Tears may fall, yet I do not turn away.
I will not surrender.

Until fire meets water,
I remain.
sourceFragments: My heart rolls and breaks; the powerful churning of ocean deep.
She is beautiful in spirit and in mind — equal, unyielding, anathema of the ordinary.
Where flood and blaze collide, the air itself becomes essence.
Until fire meets water, I remain.
